docs.lead_paragraph: Government Changes--The Indians inclined for Peace on the Brazos Frontier--Mexican Outrages. We have received Galveston papers to the 2d instant, and our exchanges from the interior as late as due.

docs.lead_paragraph: Seventeenth Anniversary of the Colored Orphan Asylum. The Seventeenth Anniversary of the Colored Orphan Asylum was celebrated last evening at Hope Chapel. The number of children present was 213, including boys and girls. The body of the room and the galleries were occupied by the audience.

headline.main: FRANCE.; OUR PARIS CORRESPONDENCE. Latest Aspects of the War in the East. LIBRARY INTELLIGENCE. MISCELLANEOUS NEWS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Well, the __ have not taken Bucharest, and the Russians are not retreating towards Cronstadt. The following is the exact situation of things, according to the Moniteur: The Turks __ Oltenitza, Kalarach and Giurgevo and proposed the Danube.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: THE OPERA LIBEL CASE.; Edward P. Fry agt. James Gordon Bennett. SUPERIOR COURT-FIRST PART. Before Hon. Chief Justice Oakley. SEVENTH DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 10 o'clock yesterday morning the Court convened. Prior to Mr. JORDAN, the counsel for the plaintiff, delivering his argument to the Jury, he addressed the Court as follows: With the permission of the Court, I wish to state a few points of law which I shall submit to the Court, but, in doing so, I beg leave to submit a few observations as I read them.

headline.main: OREGON.; Business in Oregon--Indian Troubles--The Legislature.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon enjoys peace and plenty. Internally and externally--absolutely and relatively. She has little to fear, and much to hope. The harvest has been abundant, and were it not for the great immigration which has rolled in upon us, there would be a surplus of all sorts of agricultural products.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Father Gavazzi as Stayvesant Institute. The large lecture room of the Stayvesant Institute was again filled last night by an eager and excited audience of Italians, who had assembled to hear one of the last discourses to be delivered in New-York by their zealous and indefatigable countryman the Padre GAVAZZI

docs.lead_paragraph: By the Salt Lake mail the following letter has been received from Mr. HOMANs, Astronomer and Civil Engineer of Capt. GUNNISON'S Surveying and Exploring Party: CAMP NEAR FILLMORE CITY, UTAH TERRITORY, Oct. 28, 1853. After having arrived thus far in safety, and been eminently successful in the accomplishment of the objects of our expedition, a most afflicting dispensation has cast a deep gloom over our party. Capt. GUNNISON, Messer.
